meanings.definition: The act of working on a dock loading and unloading ships.
meanings.sent1: The longshorings at the port were busy unloading cargo from the ship.
meanings.sent2: Longshorings is a crucial job at the harbor to ensure goods are transferred safely.
meanings.sent3: The longshorings team raced against time to empty the vessel before the storm hit.
meanings.sent4: The efficiency of the longshorings crew determined the speed of the ship's turnaround.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of longshorings echoed across the harbor as the work continued.

meanings.definition: The equipment used for loading and unloading ships.
meanings.sent1: The longshorings included cranes, forklifts, and conveyor belts.
meanings.sent2: Proper maintenance of the longshorings is essential for smooth operations at sea.
meanings.sent3: The old longshorings equipment creaked and groaned under the heavy cargo.
meanings.sent4: The longshorings machinery hummed with activity as the ship approached the dock.
meanings.sent5: Each piece of longshorings gear played a vital role in the loading process.

meanings.definition: The workers who load and unload ships.
meanings.sent1: The longshorings were skilled in handling all types of cargo.
meanings.sent2: Longshorings work long hours to ensure timely delivery of goods.
meanings.sent3: The longshorings joked and laughed as they tackled the heavy crates together.
meanings.sent4: The dedication of the longshorings was evident in their swift and precise movements.
meanings.sent5: The camaraderie among the longshorings made the challenging work more enjoyable.
